title: US Trailer for French Dramedy 'Rose' Starring Françoise Fabian as Rose
description: "What's the point of pampering myself at my age?" Cohen Media Group has unveiled an official US trailer for an indie French film called Rose, which is finally getting a US release this winter. It originally premiered way back in 2021 at the Locarno Film Festival where it won an award - but hasn't even been released in the last 4 years. It most recently played at as the Closing Night Film at Lincoln Center's New York Jewish Film Festival. Directed by musician and actress Aurélie Saada, this is her feature directorial debut. text: TRAILERS by January 8, 2025Source: YouTube "What's the point of pampering myself at my age?" Cohen Media Group has unveiled an official US trailer for an indie French film called Rose, which is finally getting a US release this winter. It originally premiered way back in 2021 at the Locarno Film Festival where it won an award - but hasn't even been released in the last 4 years. It most recently played at as the Closing Night Film at Lincoln Center's New York Jewish Film Festival. Directed by musician and actress Aurélie Saada, this is her feature directorial debut. When Rose, 78, loses her husband, her grief inspires her to live as fully as possible and go out and pamper herself again. Her children disapprove, forcing them all to confront what it means to redefine oneself later in life. The film is described as being similar to Thelma or Driving Madeleine - they're "emotionally moving and powerful, filled with laughter, tears and smiles throughout." This stars Françoise Fabian as the titular Rose, with Aure Atika, Grégory Montel, Damien Chapelle, Mehdi Nebbou, and Pascal Elbé. Get a look below. Here's the official US trailer (+ poster) for Aurélie Saada's film Rose, direct from CMG's YouTube: Starring Award Winning actress, Françoise Fabian, as the title character, Rose, tells the story of a 78 year old woman who has just lost her adored husband. When her grief gives way to a powerful impulse to live, making her realize that she can still redefine herself as a woman, the whole balance of the family is upset. Rose is directed by French indie actor / musician / filmmaker Aurélie Saada, who has made her feature directorial debut after also writing the script for Foon previously. The screenplay is written by Aurélie Saada and Yaël Langmann; from an idea by Aurélie Saada. It's produced by Priscilla Bertin, Judith Nora, and Elsa Rodde. The film first premiered at the 2021 Locarno Film Festival a few years ago, where it won the Piazza Grande Award; it also played at the 2022 Warsaw Jewish Film Festival. Cohen Media Group debuts Aurélie Saada's Rose in select US theaters starting January 24th, 2025 this winter. Who's interested in watching?
